view.name: Task Explorer
description: Extension to add support for tasks in VSCode.
config.taskexplorer.enableExplorerView: Enable **Task Explorer** in the `Files Explorer` view.
config.taskexplorer.enabledTaskTypes: Enabled task types to display in the task tree
config.taskexplorer.environment: Configure Task Explorer specific environment variable names and values.  Used in specific cases only, e.g. the `Jenkins` task provider.
config.taskexplorer.exclude: Configure `glob` patterns for folders and files that should be excluded from script detection.
config.taskexplorer.excludeTask: Configure `regex` patterns for individual tasks that should be excluded from task tree inclusion.
config.taskexplorer.globPatternsAnt: Configure glob patterns for locating Apache Ant files not named b(B)uild.xml.
config.taskexplorer.globPatternsBash: Configure the glob patterns for locating bash scripts, can be used to locate scripts with no extension.
config.taskexplorer.groupWithSeparator: If script names contain the configured separator, break them into grouped nodes according to similar fist parts.
config.taskexplorer.groupSeparator: The separator to use when grouping tasks.
config.taskexplorer.groupMaxLevel: Maximum grouping level (tree node depth) of grouped tasks
config.taskexplorer.groupStripTaskLabel: Strip extracted grouping labels from the task name displayed in the tree
config.taskexplorer.includeAntDsc: Configure glob patterns for locating Apache Ant files not named b(B)uild.xml.
config.taskexplorer.keepTermOnStop: Keep terminal open when stopping a task.
config.taskexplorer.trackUsage: Track application usage. **NOTE:** Disabling this setting will also disable `#taskMonitor.trackStats#`
config.taskexplorer.allowUsageReporting: Allow application usage tracking to be submitted to the Task Explorer app server.
config.taskexplorer.logging.enable: Turn on logging. Log messages are written to either the `Task Explorer` output window or to file, dependent on the `#logging.enableFile#` and `#logging.enableOutputWindow#` settings.
config.taskexplorer.logging.enableFile: Enable logging to file (check the output window for location). If `#logging.enable#` is *on*, either writing to file or to the output window should be enabled. Has no effect if `#logging.enabled#` is *off*.
config.taskexplorer.logging.enableFileSy: Enable decorative and folding (soon) symbols in log file. Has no effect if `#logging.enable#` or `#logging.enableFile#` are *off*.
config.taskexplorer.logging.enableOutput: Enable logging to a VSCode output window.  If `#logging.enable#` is *on*, either writing to file or to the output window should be enabled. Has no effect if `#logging.enabled#` is *off*.
config.taskexplorer.logging.level: Set debug verbosity (1 - Low / 5 - High). Has no effect if `#logging.enable#` is disabled.
config.taskexplorer.pathToPrograms: Paths to programs, if not registered in system path
config.taskexplorer.pathToAnsicon: Local path to the Ansicon executable
config.taskexplorer.pathToAnt: Local path to the Ant executable
config.taskexplorer.pathToBash: Local path to the Bash / sh executable
config.taskexplorer.pathToComposer: Local path to the Composer executable
config.taskexplorer.pathToCurl: Local path to the Curl executable
config.taskexplorer.pathToGradle: Local path to the Gradle executable
config.taskexplorer.pathToJenkins: Root URL of a Jenkins Server (no trailing slash), e.g. https://jenkins.mydomain.com
config.taskexplorer.pathToMake: Local path to the Make executable
config.taskexplorer.pathToMaven: Local path to the Maven executable
config.taskexplorer.pathToNsis: Local path to the Nullsoft Installer executable
config.taskexplorer.pathToPerl: Local path to the Perl executable
config.taskexplorer.pathToPipenv: Local path to the Pipenv executable
config.taskexplorer.pathToPowershell: Local path to the Powershell executable
config.taskexplorer.pathToPython: Local path to the Python executable
config.taskexplorer.pathToRuby: Local path to the Ruby executable
config.taskexplorer.showHiddenWsTasks: Include VSCode tasks in the explorer tree that have the `hide` property set to `true`.  Has no effect if `workspace` tasks are disabled in `#enabledTasks#`
config.taskexplorer.showRunningTask: Show the most recently started running task in the status bar
config.taskexplorer.sortProjectFoldersAl: Sort project folders alphabetically.  If not set, folders appear in the same order as the File Explorer View.
config.taskexplorer.useAnt: Use the `ant` program itself to find it's tasks.
config.taskexplorer.useGulp: Use the `gulp` program itself to find it's tasks.  Note this is **extremely slow** as npx/gulp takes ~0.5-1s to parse a single file.
config.taskexplorer.specialFolders.folde: Specify tree node expansion states on startup for special folders and project folders.  Property names of new items should be **camel cased** with **no spaces**.  A value of `true` indicates the folder should be expanded on startup, `false` indicates the folder should be collapsed.
config.taskexplorer.specialFolders.numLa: The number of tasks to store in the `Last Tasks` tree folder node
config.taskexplorer.specialFolders.showF: Show a `Favorites` main folder in the task tree to group frequently ran tasks in.
config.taskexplorer.specialFolders.showL: Show `Last Tasks` as a main folder in the task tree.
config.taskexplorer.specialFolders.showU: Display user workspace tasks from data directory.
config.taskexplorer.taskButtons.clickAct: Action to perform when clicking on the main body of a task tree entry
config.taskexplorer.taskButtons.controlC: The character to send to the terminal following the control character (i.e. *CTRL+C*) when `#keepTermOnStop#` is enabled.  In the U.S., this would be `Y`
config.taskexplorer.taskButtons.showExec: Show the `Execute with No Terminal` button inline with the Execute button.
Show the `Execute with Arguments` button inline with the Execute button.
config.taskexplorer.taskButtons.showFavo: Show the `Favorites` button inline with the Execute button. Has no effect if `#specialFolders.showFavorites#` is disabled.
config.taskexplorer.taskMonitor.trackSta: Track task runtime stats to view performance over time and icon animations for fastest/slowest runtimes. Has no effect if `#trackUsagee#` is disabled.
config.taskexplorer.visual.disableAnimat: Use static non-animated icons for running tasks as opposed to the spinning icons.
config.taskexplorer.visual.enableAnsicon: Enable/use ansicon output colorization for ant tasks.
taskexplorer.parseError: Task Explorer task detection: failed to parse the file {0}
taskdef.task.cmdLine: The command line used to execute the script in a shell.
taskdef.task.fileName: The file that the target was found in.
taskdef.task.fileUri: The uri object of file that the target was found in.
taskdef.task.icon: The icon paths to use in the task tree.  Specify two properties on an object - light and dark
taskdef.task.isDefault: For Ant tasks, indicates the 'default' task.
taskdef.task.path: The relative path to the folder that contains the task file.
taskdef.task.scriptFile: Boolean to display filename as the script target. Set to true.
taskdef.task.scriptType: The type of script (bash, batch, python, etc...).
taskdef.task.takesArgs: Boolean to indicate if the script accepts command line args.
taskdef.task.taskItemId: The tree item id that the task is associated with.
taskdef.task.uri: The uri of the task file.
command.clearFavorites: Clear all tasks from the `Favorites` folder
command.clearLastTasks: Clear all tasks from the `Last Tasks` folder
command.clearTaskStats: Clear all  record task statistics used by the `Task Usage` view
command.addToExcludesEx: Task Explorer: Add to Excludes List
command.disableTaskType: Task Explorer: Disable Tasks of this Type
command.enableTaskType: Task Explorer: Enable Tasks of this Type
command.openBugReports: Task Explorer: Open Github Bug Reports Page
command.openRepository: Task Explorer: Open Github Repository Page
command.removeFromExcludes: Task Explorer: Remove from Excludes List
command.setPinned: Set task pinned state for current list
command.showOutput: Task Explorer: Show Log Output Window
messages.noAssociatedTaskType: This file does not appear to be associated to any known task type
